##Basic Operator  

###1. Arithmetic Operators
Operator|	Description 
-|-
+|	Addition  
¡V|	Subtraction  
*|	Multiplication  
/|	Division  
^|	Exponent  
%%|	Modulus (Remainder from division)  
%/%|	Integer Division  
```{r}
8+7
```
###2. Relational Operators
Operator|	Description 
-|-
<|	Less than
>|	Greater than
<=|	Less than or equal to
>=|	Greater than or equal to
==|	Equal to
!=|	Not equal to
```{r}
1>2
```

###3. Logical Operators
Operator|	Description 
-|-
!|	Logical NOT
&|	Element-wise logical AND
&&|	Logical AND
\|\ |	Element-wise logical OR
\|\|\ |	Logical OR
```{r}
(1>0) && (-1>0)


x=c(1,2,3) 
y=c(3,2,1)
(x>2)|(y>2)

```

##Graphics

* Dot charts  
* Pie charts

###1. Bar charts

VADeaths
```

```

###2. Dot charts
```{r,fig.align="left"}

```

###3. Pie charts
```{r,fig.align="right"}

pie(groupsizes, labels, col=c("grey40", "white", "grey", "black", "grey90")) 
```

###4. Histograms

```{r}

hist(x)
```

###5. Box plots

```{r}

```

###6. Scatterplots
```{r}
 x <- rnorm(100)
 y <- rpois(100, 30) 
 plot(x, y, main = "Poisson versus Normal")

```

###7. QQ plots
```{r}
 X <- rnorm(1000) 
 A <- rnorm(1000) 
 qqplot(X, A, main="A and X are the same") 
```

##Function 
* for
* if
* while
* repeat (break)

###1. for
```{r}
Fibonacci <- numeric(12) 
Fibonacci[1] <- Fibonacci[2] <- 1 
for (i in 3:12) Fibonacci[i] <- Fibonacci[i - 2] + Fibonacci[i - 1]
Fibonacci
```

###2. if
```{r}
x <- 3 
if (x > 2) y <- 2 * x else y <- 3 * x 
y
```
###3. while
```{r}
 Fib1 <- 1 
 Fib2 <- 1 
 Fibonacci <- c(Fib1, Fib2) 
 while (Fib2 < 300) { 
  Fibonacci <- c(Fibonacci, Fib2) 
  oldFib2 <- Fib2 
  Fib2 <- Fib1 +Fib2 
  Fib1 <- oldFib2 
 }
Fibonacci
```
###4. repeat (break)
```{r}
i <- 1
result <- 0
repeat{
  if(i > 135) break 
  result <- result + i
  i <- i + 1
}
result
```
##Simulation
* uniform
* Binomial  
* Poisson
* Exponential
* Normal

###1. uniform
```{r}
runif(5)
```
generate 5 random variabes
###2. Binomial
```{r}
rbinom(24, 15, 0.1)

```
generate 24 random variabes
```{r}
Binomial_d=dbinom(x = 4, size = 6, prob = 0.5) 
```
$P(X =4)$ is `r Binomial_d`

```{r}
Binomial_p=pbinom(4, 6, 0.5)
```
$P(X \leq 4)$  is `r Binomial_p`
```{r}
Binomial_q=qbinom(0.89, 6, 0.5) 
```
The 89th percentile of the distribution of X  is `r Binomial_q` 
###3. Poisson
```{r}
 rpois(10, 3.7) 
```
generate 10 random variabes
```{r}
Poisson_d=dpois(x = 3, lambda = 0.5) 
```
$P(X =3)$ is `r Poisson_d`
```{r}
Poisson_p=ppois(3,0.5)
```
$P(X \leq 3)$  is `r Poisson_p`
```{r}
Poisson_q=qpois(0.89,0.5)
```
The 89th percentile of the distribution of X  is `r Poisson_q` 
###4. Exponential
```{r}
rexp(10, rate = 3) 
```
generate 10 random variabes
```{r}
Exponential_d=dexp(1, rate = 3)
```
$f(1) =$ `r Exponential_d`
```{r}
Exponential_p=pexp(1, rate = 3)

```
$F(1) =$ `r Exponential_p`
```{r}
Exponential_q=qexp(0.89,rate = 3)

```
The 89th percentile of the distribution of X  is `r Exponential_q`  

###5. Normal
```{r}
rnorm(10, 0, 0.5)
```
generate 10 random variabes
```{r}
Normal_d=dnorm(0,0,0.5)
```
$f(0) =$ `r Normal_d`
```{r}
Normal_p=pnorm(0,0,0.5)
```
$F(0) =$ `r Normal_p`
```{r}
Normal_q=qnorm(0.89,0,0.5)

```

The 89th percentile of the distribution of X  is `r Normal_q` 

## Linear programming
```{r,echo=F,warning=F}
library(lpSolve)
```
$$minC =5x_1 +8x_2$$  
$$x_1 +x_2 \geq 2$$
$$x_1 +2x_2 \geq 3$$
$$x_1,x_2 \geq 0$$
```{r}
eg.lp <- lp(objective.in=c(5, 8), const.mat=matrix(c(1, 1, 1, 2),  nrow=2), const.rhs=c(2, 3), const.dir=c(">=", ">="))
eg.lp
x1x2=eg.lp$solution 
```
(x1,x2)=(`r x1x2`)  
$$minC =5x_1 +8x_2=13$$
